messages.text:
U08P7B2EJUW - I have kicked off this channel for February with the vision that it would be Vanessa and Cribl. Let me know what you need from me to gauge if Vanessa would be a good speaker on a topic we would be interested in. Once we know we want to go in that direction and have a rough sense of the date, we can engage Cribl via the slack channel.

Let me know if you have questions

U08UZM1P90R - another automation opportunity - pre-populating the channels for events of the year to hold space for conversation and scouting

topic ideas from Vanessa:
1. Strategic Focus and how to bring that back
 a. Could be a bend with AI as well
2. Process vs Infrastructure not everything needs to be a process
3. What are truly the jobs within the ProdDev org PM vs Designer vs Marketing vs Growth
I am leaning towards option 1. She is quite a dynamic speaker. Very Chris Butler like

Available 2/18 and 2/25

I like the strategy focus, particularly how strategy works in tandem execution. In my experience in Product orgs, people can get myopic and focused on output or locally optimized outcomes. A discussion on strategy would help build that drill up skill, and also open up product people to more engaging discussions with executives and leadership. 

AI can be used a thought partner for exploring strategy, and guardrail to warn when prod teams are building features that dont align with strategy.

Also, how can product people speak upwards to leadership when what they are seeing on the ground doesnt seem to align with strategy.

I agree with option 1.

I checked our speaker https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GN2mAqlv_QRdCD4cuIplw_8IbwfjwpdlHTe7CSlcagY/edit?gid=206355470#gid=206355470 - form responses, and I dont see Vanessas...can someone fact check me? do we have a new form?

replies.text:
Is it the ideal practice that a new speaker fill out the form? I dont see Dan in there. Is it the ideal practice that a new speakers data is populated in this spreadsheet?

I think it is happening informally over email. If that isnt the case, we should document the ideal process so we can understand the gap between the informal process. Is documenting the speaker information too heavy _feedback about Linear from Karsh?_ Is there a way to create a lighter process?

I did create a checklist in this task template, but does it need more specific links to the form?

https://linear.app/product-tank-sf/issue/PRO-61/event-name-ie-jan-2026-11-secure-speaker

yes, ideal practice is that they fill out the form, but we make exceptions occasionally based on just the natural flow of convos and the speaker. for example, Dan is in high-demand as a speaker and we can work through the questions via email.

the speakers should be given the form link. the form responses are for us to review. these are both in the PTank Google Drive folder - but I dont know if theres a new form because I dont see Vanessas response.

replies.text: Sure. Ill take it on

replies.text:
I dont know. Id guess 2 out of 10 confidence that Warren delivers the final video edits, titles, audio normalized. One would need to compare the Vimeo videos to YouTube see what MTP adds.

Its an odd relationship with MTP. We get sponsors to pay for content that goes on MTP channel owned by Pendo.
Agreed it is an odd relationship

messages.text: Ahh no worries Glad it was already in progress U07KCG0C97C

Warren does definitely edit the video -- sample vid that he sent over to MTP: https://vimeo.com/1114457270?fl=pl&fe=sh password: mind

It got uploaded as is to youtube, so warrens version was essentially ready to go. I think a recording from Cribl would work too, but it wont be as polished/concise
We can use this as an experiment and use the free or get a sponsor ai tools to edit for us and provide to MTP for YouTube upload. We can ask a volunteer to help.

replies.text:
U08UZM1P90R U08P7B2EJUW thoughts on this idea?

U07H0LFU51D - worst case we send the raw file to MTP and let them edit it to their liking adding title slides or whatever?
I honestly dont know what the outcome would be, U07H0LFU51D do you have a specific tool in mind?
The experiment would be how hard would it be to create a good enough / warren quality videocan we do this with volunteers and basic a/v like Crible has, U08P7B2EJUW
U07KCG0C97C yes that could be are fall back but if Louron doesnt do it, our events prob wont get posted so I think we still get a volunteer to help us create something.
I meant Im skeptical of the outcome of the video edit itself hehe
But ofc support it Do you have a specific ai tool in mind?

I do not but we should make it a challenge to the community. Theres a lot of stuff out there. We can pose it as a learning challenge and they get to present 5 min at an upcoming event Winner winner chicken dinner
Ill take point on testing using jan unedited recording.
super neat idea to engage the community U07H0LFU51D

messages.text: Hi rock starts Sorry to push a sub-optimal process but until we have our retro and get to the next level, this is what I believe is the most effective way to stay in synchNot the best and we should work on that. But outcome over process.I know we have process debt. hence why we need to do the retro - see my post in organizer-leads. Thank you all so much
DRI/Status as of 1/26/26
